name: Soho Boutique Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Soho for 2 nights. We liked it but we got a very good deal (68 euro per night) and if we had paid more I think we would have been disappointed. The room was very nicely designed but tiny!! However it really was nice and very comfortable. The lobby and restaurant were very nice but seemed a bit cheap! Can’t quite put my finger on it but it had something to do with the staff all wearing orange jumpers which made it feel like you were on an easyjet flight!! Breakfast was terrible, cold bacon and eggs, orange 'juice' that was like flavoured water. There was only one beer in the minibar and when I rang down and asked for more (it was late at night), I was told by quite a rude receptionist that he is not a barman!! Otherwise I have to say the staff were very helpful and were extra helpful with some queries I had before we arrived. Location was good but the particular street is not too nice. Overall I would recommend it but it’s not really a 4 star so don’t pay 4 star prices!!
reviews.title: Good value, nice design....but lacks that special something!

reviews.text: I loved the style and decor of this hotel. The room was small but stylish, clean, and the bed was large enough. Staff at the front desk was helpful. Bar was closed after midnight which was the only negative point. Overall a very pleasant experience.
reviews.title: Loved the style

reviews.text: The Soho is a small and stylish hotel which was inaugurated in September 2008. The rooms are quite small (especially the bathroom) but as we had double rooms for single use, it was OK.
reviews.title: Small, stylish hotel in an 15' walk to the center

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A cool feature: You can watch TV while showering!
reviews.title: Nice recommendable place for young people, but...

likes.liked: — near to city center, clean room, nice breakfast
likes.disliked: — a little noisy, bathroom has only glassy doors and walls, and first of all I got rid of some of my belongings

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff in the hotel was friendly and corteous. They lent us an umbrella unasked when it was raining outside. All of them spoke at least english, most of them also some german.
reviews.title: Poor Hotel in Budapest

reviews.text: I booked this hotel expecting a 4* hotel - the price was £97inc breakfast. The hotel is in a bad part of the town. The rooms are very very small and although the hotel is new (still undergoing work). Airconditioning does not work properly. We check out the next morning and moved to the marriott - £200 but we need the rest after our night at this hotel. My advice - go 5* or book an older 4* hotel - where the rooms are bigger and you don feel like you are in a prison cell.
reviews.title: Hotel Terrible not Hotel Soho

likes.liked: — there was nothing to like about it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at Soho Hotel for 4 days and 3 nights (from September 5th - 8th, 2008). When I entered the lobby, I noticed that the wall paper on the wall was not smooth, indicating that they did not do a good job with the construction since I am an interior designer.
reviews.title: Modern hotel, but too small with be rated a 4-star hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was too small, and the bathroom was even smaller. Both of us are not big in size, and we brought with us only 2 small carry-on suitcases, yet there were not enough space for us to move around.
reviews.title: First Night stay

likes.disliked: — a few opening day problems...but they were working hard to solve them

description: May it be a business trip, a city tour or relaxation, the new 4* boutique hotel of the Hungarian capital will give an unforgettable experience. Beyond the scents, flavours, sights, the silent tranquility, the tangible splendour and winged imagination, discover the seventh of all senses: Soho! Give in to the temptation and take a walk in the world of sensuality.
